Software and technology for the development or production of these components and equipment are also included.
Applications for exporting commodities and products to Iraq should be forwarded to the Office of the Iraq Programme (OIP) with technical specifications and end-user information. 
The OIP and UNMOVIC experts, consulting the IAEA, review applications and concluded contractual arrangements to determine if the contract contains items referred to in paragraph 24 of resolution 687 (1991) or listed on the Goods Review List (GRL). 
The experts may request additional information within 60 days. 
If the contract contains items referred to in paragraph 24, the application lapses. 
If the contract contains GRL items, the Committee receives full details, and an assessment of humanitarian, economic, and security implications. 
If the contract does not contain restricted items, the OIP informs the Government of Iraq and the exporting State, and the exporter is eligible for payment upon verification by Cotecna. 
The mission or agency may appeal the decision to refer the contract to the Committee within two business days to the Executive Director of OIP. 
Experts reviewing contracts should be drawn from a broad geographical base. 
The Secretariat reports to the Committee every 180 days on contracts submitted and approved. 
The Committee keeps these procedures under review and amends them as appropriate. 
Any Committee member may call for an urgent meeting to consider revising or revoking these procedures.
